abstract_problem: A sustainable energy grid operator manages a portfolio of generation assets to meet demand while ensuring grid stability. The planning horizon consists of T consecutive time intervals. Each asset has specific technical capabilities (min/max output) and economic parameters (marginal/fixed costs). The grid must maintain a reliability margin (spinning reserve) at all times. Operational constraints include thermal stress limits (min up/down times) and activation surcharges. The goal is to minimize the total cost of operation and activation while satisfying all demand and stability requirements.

units.description:
Registry of generation assets. Contains string identifiers and metadata.
- `unit_id`: Unique string identifier (e.g., 'GEN_019').
- `manufacturer`: Asset manufacturer (decoy).
- `installation_date`: Date of installation (decoy).
- `efficiency_rating`: Efficiency metric (decoy).

mode_specs.description:
Technical specifications for asset operating modes.
- `unit_id`: Asset identifier.
- `mode_id`: Mode identifier.
- `min_output`: Minimum power output (MW).
- `max_output`: Maximum power output (MW).

mode_costs.description:
Economic parameters for asset operating modes.
- `unit_id`: Asset identifier.
- `mode_id`: Mode identifier.
- `marginal_cost`: Cost per unit of output ($/MW).
- `fixed_cost`: Hourly fixed cost when active ($/h).

system_requirements.description:
Grid demand and reliability requirements per time interval.
- `time_id`: Time interval index (**0-based**, i.e., 0 to T-1).
- `demand`: System load (MW).
- `spinning_reserve_requirement`: Required reliability margin (MW).

policy_rules.description:
Operational policy rules defining constraints.
- `rule_id`: Unique rule identifier.
- `rule_family`: Business category of the rule. Values:
    - `GRID_STABILITY_CONSTRAINT`: Demand balance rules.
    - `RELIABILITY_MARGIN_REQ`: Spinning reserve rules.
    - `THERMAL_STRESS_LIMIT_TYPE_A`: Minimum up-time logic.
    - `THERMAL_STRESS_LIMIT_TYPE_B`: Minimum down-time logic.
    - `ACTIVATION_SURCHARGE_LOGIC`: Startup cost logic.
    - `OPERATIONAL_STATUS_LINK`: Logic linking online status to start/stop.
    - `SHUTDOWN_TRAJECTORY_BOUND`: Shutdown trajectory logic.
    - `STARTUP_TRAJECTORY_BOUND`: Startup trajectory logic.
    - `INITIAL_STATE_PATCH`: Initial condition logic.
    - `EXCLUSIVITY`: Mutually exclusive mode logic.
    - `START_STAGE_LINK`: Startup stage logic.
    - `STOP_STAGE_LINK`: Shutdown stage logic.
- `time_id`: Time interval index (**1-based**, i.e., 1 to T). Note the index difference compared to `system_requirements.csv`. To map requirements to rules, use `rule_time_id = req_time_id + 1`.
- `sense`: Comparison operator (`<=`, `=`, `>=`).
- `rhs`: Right-hand side value.

policy_rule_terms.description:
Detailed terms for policy rules.
- `rule_id`: Link to `policy_rules.csv`.
- `term_type`: Variable type. Values:
    - `GEN`: Power output of an asset in a specific mode.
    - `ONLINE`: Binary indicator for an online asset.
    - `START`: Binary indicator for a startup event.
    - `STOP`: Binary indicator for a shutdown event.
    - `START_STAGE`: Binary indicator for a specific startup trajectory stage.
    - `STOP_STAGE`: Binary indicator for a specific shutdown trajectory stage.
    - `STARTUP_COST`: Continuous variable for accumulated startup costs.
    - `UNSERVED`: Continuous variable for load curtailment.
- `time_id`: Time interval index (**1-based**).
- `coef`: Coefficient.

mode_unavailability_windows.description: Periods where specific asset modes are unavailable.

start_stop_event_cost_windows.description:
Time windows for activation/deactivation surcharges.
- `event_type`: Type of event. Values: `START`, `STOP`.

ambient_conditions.description: Environmental data (solar irradiance, wind speed) for renewable forecasting (decoy).

asset_registry.description: Additional asset metadata including grid connection points (decoy).
